answers.answer: It is very scary when we find this out but it isn't a death sentence.  I was just concerned I wouldn't see my grandkids grow up and now that I know I will it's better.If they haven't already done blood work to know your geno type, viral load, alt & ast they will do that.  My Dr also ran tests to make sure I din't have anything else, ie. hiv, diabetes, hep a & b, etc.  You'll probably be told to go get shots for hep a & B so you don't get that.  You probably go get a biopsy to see what kind of damage has been done.  I can't think of anything else right now.  Don't worry about the biopsy, it wasn't that bad as long as they give you something to make you feel goofy.Best of luck, stick with the people at this forum. Find a support group and pray hard and alot.Blessings to you,In HIS Hands,Linda
